image_prompt: Madhubani-style illustration. Vibrant colours, depicting the Sun and Moon as anthropomorphic figures. The Sun is depicted with angry facial expression, throwing dark ash towards a bright, full Moon. Background shows a lush green landscape with stylized trees and rolling hills.  The Sun is wearing traditional Rajasthani attire, the Moon in simple white clothing.
audio_text: సూర్యుడు కోపంగా ఉన్నాడు, చందమామ మీద బూడిద విసిరాడు (sūryuḍu kōpāṅgā unnāḍu, chandamama mīda būḍida visirāḍu)

image_prompt: Warli tribal art with white-on-red motifs.  A large, partially obscured moon is the central figure, its face showing sadness.  Small, simple figures of villagers are shown stumbling in darkness.  The background is a dark night sky with minimal detail, emphasizing the lack of moonlight.
audio_text: చందమామ దాగిపోయింది, చీకటి పడింది (chandamama dāgipoyindi, cīkaṭi paḍindi)

image_prompt: Pattachitra style painting.  A little girl, dressed in simple cotton clothes, is shown praying with hands clasped, looking up at a dark sky.  The background features a stylized village scene with houses and trees, painted in traditional Odisha colours.
audio_text: చిన్నారి ప్రార్థన చేసింది, చందమామ కోసం (cinnāri prārthanā cēsindi, chandamama kōsam)

image_prompt: Madhubani style, but with a softer colour palette. The moon, now showing dark spots, is depicted gently shining its light on a village scene. Villagers are shown working in fields under the soft moonlight.  The style emphasizes peace and serenity.
audio_text: చందమామ తిరిగి వచ్చింది, క్షమించండి (chandamama tirigini vacchindi, kshaminchandi)

image_prompt: Warli art style.  Farmers are shown happily harvesting crops under the gentle moonlight.  The moon is depicted with its spots, but it is radiating a soft, warm glow.  The scene emphasizes joy and abundance.
audio_text: పంటలు పండి, సంతోషం ఉంది (paṇṭalu paṇḍi, santoṣaṁ undi)

image_prompt: A combination of styles – the central focus is the moon, depicted in a realistic style with its dark spots prominently featured, surrounded by a frame in the style of Tanjore painting with gold leaf accents.  Children are playing joyfully under the moonlight.

Madhubani style. The moon is depicted as a benevolent figure, surrounded by stars and floral motifs. The overall tone is one of peace and acceptance.  A small text in Telugu is included, stating: “అపూర్ణతలు మనల్ని ప్రత్యేకంగా చేస్తాయి” (apūrṇatulu manalni pratyēkaṅgā chēstāyi) – Imperfections make us special.
